tr.td: Accident and emergency or dental casualty department of the Health Care Provider
NHS other Hospital Provider - Ward for general Patients or the younger physically disabled or A and E department
Description of reaction: Rash. No swelling/anaphylaxis

td.p: 60 year old man complaining of chest pain lasting around 2 hours.
Coronary angiogram demonstrated diseased RCA, drug eluting stent successfully placed.
Appropriate secondary prevention medications prescribed for follow up with Cardiac Rehabilitation team.

tr.td: Chest pain onset date/time 12 February 2015 08:00. Asserted by patient.
Asserted date 12 February 2015 by Mr Abacus.
Asserted date 12 February 2015 by Dr. Amanda Smith
Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent
Discharge type: Usual place of residence
MGP Medical Centre, 1 MGP House, Overtown, Leeds, LS21 7PA
Hospital needs to arrange for transportation to the patient's home, and inform social services that the patient needs a carer.
Patient seen by Cardiac Rehab and information given regarding diagnosis, lifestyle change and benefits of rehab programme. Community follow up planned.

td.pre:
Full Blood Count
Test Value Units Reference Range White Cell Count 11.1 x10*9/L 3.5 - 10.0 Red Cell Count 5.0 x10*12/L 4.25 - 5.75 Haemoglobin 150 g/L 13.0 - 17.0 Haematocrit 0.230 0.400 - 0.500 Mean Cell Volume 90 fL 84 - 98 Mean Cell Hb 33.0 pg 27.5 - 32.0 Mean Cell Hb Con 34.0 pg 31.0 - 35.0 RDW 12.0 % < 14.5 Platelet Count 300 x10*9/L 150 - 400
Machine Differential
Test Value Units Reference Range Neutrophils 7.0 x10*9/L 1.7 - 7.5 Lymphocytes 3.5 x10*9/L 1.0 - 3.5 Monocytes 0.3 x10*9/L < 0.6 Eosinophils 0.4 x10*9/L < 0.4 Basophils 0.1 x10*9/L < 0.1 LUCs 0.2 x10*9/L < 0.4

tr.td: Dose directions description: One 2.5mg tablet once a day.
Dose directions description: One 20mg tablet once a day or as needed.
Dose directions description: Take one 75mg tablet once a day.
Dose directions description: Take one 75mg tablet daily for one year then stop.
Dose directions description: Take one 40mg tablet once a day.
Dose directions description: Take one 5mg tablet daily.
Comment/recommendation: Uptitrate according to BP and HR

title.value: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes

display.value: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes

tr.th: Person and carer concerns, expectations and wishes
tr.td: The carer is concerned about the possibility of the patient suffering from a heart attack, bearing a similarity to the illness of the mother of the patient. The patient is worried about the impact of their illness on their ability to work and drive.
